item.title: Dns Outage
item.description: For a short A entry TTL Does the resolver keep the 2 GTM IPs and query the second if the first doesn�t reply ? I think so and then I need to change my explaination. Client keep using A until TTL has expired. If A is 30 second and outage occure just after the DNS request for A, the outage last 30 seconds. Then the client ask the resolver who might query the GTM NS IP of the broken site, wait for the DNS query timeout then query the working GTM NS that will return the working A entry.

item.title: One of possible DNS Design
item.description: DNS Steps to resolve a web site url in IP : The following step are when nothing is yet caches in any servers. This use case is for a recusive DNS resolver. The user try to access www.toto.com from his browser. His computer send the DNS query 53 to the system configured DNS Resolver. For instance 9.9.9.9 (quad9). The recursive (not iterative) DNS resolver send the DNS query to one of the 13 root servers to know how to resovle .
